projects.name: Accommodate
projects.detail: Matchmaking platform for Accommodation search where not only the tenant can search for accommodations rather Landlords can choose their tenants as well. Accommodate was the final project of the Web Applications Engineering Masters course. The project was developed from scratch including coming up with the business idea to business modeling, architecture designing, Development, deployment and presenting to the audience.

projects.name: Lodge-In
projects.detail: Lodge-in is an implementation of a prototype application feature for exploring Hotels and Lodging services using HERE Maps API, and booking them. The project demonstrates full-stack web application development with javascript technologies. Responsive front-end for both web and mobile devices implemented in React and Material UI, communicates with REST-based backend service written in Node.js, Express.js, Typescript and MongoDB. The project is bundled with Webpack and Dockerized for local installation and execution.

projects.name: usp-web-viewer
projects.detail: Urban Strategy Playground (USP) is a research group from the TUM Chair of Architectural Informatics aimed to develop methods and tools for detecting the potential for infill development in urban planning areas and development and verification of planning strategies on inner-city planning areas. This project was done as an Interdisciplinary project which uses the power of WebGL to visualize 3D models of the urban areas and the information interactively associated with them.

projects.name: Post A Project for top.legal
projects.detail: To facilitate clients in publishing their projects for which they are seeking legal assistance, I implemented a feature that asks clients a series of questions and modifies future questions based on the already selected prior inputs. I implemented the front-end in React along with defining the model of the questions and the interconnection between them in a data-structure.

projects.name: colwiz Citation Plugins for Google Documents
projects.detail: Colwiz, now combined with Wizdom.ai is a research management solution that helps students and researchers in academia to manage their research work easily. I developed citation plugins for Google documents along with UX designers. One integrated to Colwiz's Google Chrome Extension and the other one as an independent add-on for Google Documents. The main challenges in this project were related to Google document manipulations and performance optimizations.
